page.title: 10THE BELL ROCK LIGHTHOUSE
page.content: A dangerous red sandstone reef, about two miles long, lies some twelve miles from the mouth of the River Tay and Forth. A small part of the reef is uncovered at each tide and is completely submerged by 16 feet of water at high tide.A Government Bill to erect a lighthouse on the site was passed in 1806 and John Rennie, an Engineer, was invited to be Chief Engineer with Robert Stevenson as his assistant. Rennie's design of a stone lighthouse was adopted. Due to the shortage of time available for working in the rock, the stones were shaped and dovetailed at Arbroath. Rennie acted more as a consultant and he appointed Stevenson as works engineer. He spent much of his time at the rock and was a vigorous leader. The light was first switched on in 1811 on 1st February.
